results.title: Kyushu: Japan's island of wonders
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Iwanami Productions
results.brief_description: Travelogue on Kyushu, the southern-most of Japan’s four main islands. While drawing brief attention to Japan’s expanding industrial capacity and intensive agricultural practices, the film is designed with the purpose of encouraging western tourists. Thus, it catalogues a wealth of familiar recreational pursuits, eg golf; the medicinal benefits of the numerous thermal springs and the exotic charm of Hakkata porcelain.

results.title: Kyrie
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A student called Jack is being framed by another student at his school, who accuses him of stealing his girlfriend. Jack has his exam papers forged, gets drawn into fights and is generally stalked by the jealous boyfriend. Jack cannot seem to prove his innocence and is blamed for everything by the principal of the school who doesn’t believe his stories of persecution….he later finds out why…the girl in question is the school principal’s daughter.

results.title: Kyoto: ancient capital of Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Iwanami Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the city of Kyoto, built when Japan was under the greatest influence of China. From 1794 to 1868 it was the capital city of Japan, and today is the 1100 years old cradle of Japanese art, science and culture - a city of temples, palaces and universities and the centre for research in physics, philosophy and oriental studies. It is renowned for ceramic handicrafts, porcelain, modern Japanese painting, silk weaving and beautiful brocades.

results.title: Kyomi from Japan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
The story of Kyomi and her dream of becoming an “Ama” girl. Shows Japanese girls diving for oysters on the Mikimoto farm. When the nucleus is inserted the oysters are placed in wire cages and returned to the water on suspended rafts. They are lifted and cleaned several times before the pearls are harvested. Shows grading, weighing and stringing in the factory.

results.title: Kylie: intimate & live
results.creator_credit: Mark Adamson, David Wilson and Mushroom Records Pty. Limited
results.brief_description: Join popular Australian performer Kylie Minogue on her recently successful Australian tour. Kylie is recorded live at the Capitol Theatre in Sydney, July 1st 1998 and performs hits from her past (Stock, Aitken and Waterman days) and present career including; “Too far”, “What do I have to do?”, “Some kind of bliss”, “Put yourself in my place”, “Breathe”, “Take me with you”, “I should be so lucky”, “Dancing Queen”, “Dangerous game”, “Cowboy style”, “Step back in time”, “Say hey”, “Free”, “Drunk”, “Did it again”, “Limbo”, Shocked”, “Confide in me”, “Locomotion”, “Should I stay or should I go?” and “Better the devil you know”. Includes candid interviews with the support crew including costuming, backing vocals and fellow performers.

results.title: Kylie Tennant
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
Kylie Tennant drew her inspiration from people she knew, and her exuberant interview is in itself a valuable piece of Australian social history.

results.title: Kylie
results.brief_description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.

results.title: Kwaidan = Woman of the snow
results.creator_credit: Masaki Kobayashi, Shigeru Wakatsuki and Ninjin Club
results.brief_description: Director Masaki Kobayashi’s quartet of self contained ghost stories uses to spellbinding effect highly stylised sets, expressionistic lighting and painterly backdrops in the retelling of 19th century English Orientalist Lafcadio Hearn’s writings. ‘Kwaidan’s‘ (which translates to ghost story) eerie mood is sealed by its mesmerizing and modest credit sequence followed by the first story, the foreboding ‘Shadowings’. The next instalment, ‘Yuki Onna’ (Snow Woman) uses lurid lighting and its contrived studio sets to maximum dream-like effect, while ‘The story of Miminashi Hoichi’ incorporates various modes of ancient Japanese story telling with breathtaking results. Finally, ‘In a cup of Tea’s‘ grimly surreal coda of a publisher’s frustration with the inconclusiveness of many Japanese ghost stories, aptly completes this remarkable anthology. Kobayashi’s meticulous direction, (Kobayashi’s obsessive aesthetic control drove him to hand paint all the sets himself) along with the unsettling soundtrack by Toru Takemitsu make this a unique film experience. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Keiko Kishi, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kazuo Nakamura, Tetsuro Tamba and Rentaro Mikuni (Awards: Special Jury prize 1965 Cannes Film Festival)
